biochar.title: Biochar
biochar.description1: Il biochar viene prodotto a partire da biomasse o rifiuti organici, attraverso la pirolisi (riscaldamento ad alte temperature in assenza di ossigeno), un processo che permette di concentrare il carbonio e renderlo resistente alla decomposizione biologica. Il Biochar ha molteplici usi commerciali: per esempio viene utilizzato come ammendante agricolo, nel trattamento delle acque reflue e in diversi settori industriali (e.g pneumatici, asfalto, etc).
biochar.description2: Il processo di produzione del biochar, noto come pirolisi, coinvolge il riscaldamento di diversi tipi di biomassa vegetale in un ambiente privo di ossigeno. Questo processo avviene a temperature elevate, tipicamente tra 350°C e 700°C. In queste condizioni, la biomassa si decompone termicamente senza bruciare completamente, creando una forma di carbonio stabile chiamata carbone vegetale o biochar. Durante la pirolisi, il biochar assorbe il carbonio dalla biomassa e lo intrappola nel suo reticolo strutturale, impedendone il rilascio nell'atmosfera come anidride carbonica (CO2).

list1.item1: Location indipendent: gli impianti DAC possono essere posizionati in qualsiasi luogo poiché la CO₂ nell'aria è uniformemente distribuita globalmente.
list1.item2: Estrema precisione nella misurazione della CO₂ assorbita e stoccata.

biochar.list2: Garantisce la rimozione di CO₂ per oltre 1000 anni.
biochar.list3: Favorisce lo sviluppo e la ricerca di nuove tecnologie volte alla cattura e rimozione della CO₂ dall’atmosfera.
biochar.list4: La CO₂ catturata può essere convertita in carburanti sintetici, riducendo la dipendenza dai combustibili fossili.

erw.description1: Projects in the Up2You SDG mix package ensure maximum coverage of the Sustainable Development Goals across the three pillars of sustainability: environmental, social and economic.
erw.title2: Processo di Produzione e Carbon removal
erw.description2: Project areas are rich in biodiversity at risk of disappearance. These species interact in ecosystems to maintain balance and sustain life.

sdgmix.title: SDG mix
sdgmix.description1: Projects in the Up2You Forest package are concerned with protecting and restoring forests, woodlands and natural parks, which without our help are at risk of serious damage.The world's forests, from tropical ones in the Amazon to those in Borneo, are threatened by acid rain, deforestation, fires and degradation.
sdgmix.description2: The package, being composed of both nature-based and technology-based projects, makes it possible to fund initiatives that touch on forest protection and the development of renewable energy sources in particularly disadvantaged regions where they can play a key role in the progress of local communities.

technology.title: Technology
technology.description1: Projects in the Up2You Technology package enhance the use of technology to generate environmental benefits. Through various technological solutions, it is possible to combat climate change by supporting initiatives that can reduce our emissions.
technology.description2: Supporting technology projects, such as those related to renewable energy, means encouraging the use of clean energy, enabling the reduction ofCO2 emissions into the atmosphere.

bluecarbon.title: Blue carbon
bluecarbon.description1: Projects in the Up2You Blue carbon package protect and develop coastal ecosystems by bringing many benefits, including improving waters and protecting endangered marine species.
bluecarbon.description2: Although blue carbon ecosystems cover only about 1 percent of the planet, they are responsible for half of theCO2 absorbed by the oceans. That's why it's critical to preserve them.

socialimpact.title: Social impact
socialimpact.description1: Projects in the Up2You Social impact package are not only limited to capturing or avoidingCO2 leakage, but also bring concrete benefits to the local communities in the project areas.
socialimpact.description2: Implementing a certified project guarantees the employment of several people, both for the planning or construction phase and to ensure the smooth running of the project or operation of the plant.
